intro: Thibaudia tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly thibaudia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features soft, hairy foliage that gives it its common name, and it produces clusters of small, fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Thibaudia tomentosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
